items.title: Maduro arraigned in U.S. court, Trump threatens other nations
items.standfirst: Ousted Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife appeared before a judge in New York to face charges related to drug trafficking after the U.S. military attack on Venezuela.
items.content: Ousted Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife appeared before a judge in New York to face charges related to drug trafficking after the U.S. military attack on Venezuela.

items.title: US raid on Venezuela ‘undermined a fundamental principle of international law’, says UN rights body – live
items.standfirst: Spokesperson for UN high commissioner says ‘accountability for human rights violations cannot be achieved by unilateral military intervention’Deposed Maduro pleads not guilty after capture in shock US attack on VenezuelaUS foes and allies denounce Trump’s ‘crime of aggression’ in Venezuela at UN meetingMy colleague Sibylla Brodzinsky has reported on the relationship between the US and Colombia, home to significant oil reserves. Here is an extract from her story:Colombia has long been a close partner of the US in the fight against drug trafficking and enjoyed bipartisan support in Washington but relations have soured dramatically since Trump came to office.Colombia’s narcotics trade is largely controlled by illegal armed groups such as the Gulf Clan, the National Liberation Army (ELN) and dissident factions of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (Farc) guerrilla group, the majority of whose members demobilised after a 2016 peace deal … Continue reading...
items.content: Spokesperson for UN high commissioner says ‘accountability for human rights violations cannot be achieved by unilateral military intervention’Deposed Maduro pleads not guilty after capture in shock US attack on VenezuelaUS foes and allies denounce Trump’s ‘crime of aggression’ in Venezuela at UN meetingMy colleague Sibylla Brodzinsky has reported on the relationship between the US and Colombia, home to significant oil reserves. Here is an extract from her story:Colombia has long been a close partner of the US in the fight against drug trafficking and enjoyed bipartisan support in Washington but relations have soured dramatically since Trump came to office.Colombia’s narcotics trade is largely controlled by illegal armed groups such as the Gulf Clan, the National Liberation Army (ELN) and dissident factions of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (Farc) guerrilla group, the majority of whose members demobilised after a 2016 peace deal … Continue reading...

items.title: President Trump stands ready to send U.S. Big Oil into Venezuela en masse, but the messy reality of rebuilding a ruined industry takes many years
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump says American Big Oil “want to go in so badly” into Venezuela and spend billions of dollars, but the reality is U.S. oil producers are hesitant, and it will take many years and many tens of billions of dollars to rebuild Venezuela’s decimated oil sector after the U.S…

items.title: Deposed Maduro pleads not guilty after capture in shock US attack on Venezuela
items.standfirst: President protests innocence in US court as countries at UN meeting condemn Donald Trump’s ‘crime of aggression’Venezuela crisis – latest updatesThe deposed Venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro pleaded not guilty to drugs, weapons and narco-terrorism charges on Monday, two days after his capture by US special forces in an operation ordered by Donald Trump that sent shock waves around the world.The brevity and formality of the arraignment hearing in federal court in Manhattan – barely 30 minutes during which Maduro was asked to confirm his name and that he understood the four charges against him – belied the far-reaching consequences of the US action. Continue reading...
items.content: President protests innocence in US court as countries at UN meeting condemn Donald Trump’s ‘crime of aggression’Venezuela crisis – latest updatesThe deposed Venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro pleaded not guilty to drugs, weapons and narco-terrorism charges on Monday, two days after his capture by US special forces in an operation ordered by Donald Trump that sent shock waves around the world.The brevity and formality of the arraignment hearing in federal court in Manhattan – barely 30 minutes during which Maduro was asked to confirm his name and that he understood the four charges against him – belied the far-reaching consequences of the US action. Continue reading...

items.title: Major oil companies to meet with Trump admin. on Venezuela, sources say

items.title: Machado welcomes ‘huge step for humanity’ – as it happened
items.standfirst: Venezuelan opposition leader says she plans to return to her country as soon as possibleDeposed Maduro pleads not guilty after capture in shock US attack on VenezuelaA UK minister would not be drawn into saying whether his government believes the US capture of Venezuela’s president was influenced by the country’s rich oil reserves.Asked on Sky News why he thought Donald Trump had captured Nicolás Maduro and said America would “run” Venezuela, Home Office minister Mike Tapp said:This is for Donald Trump to answer, and I think he has said in his press conference, which I watched with interest around narco-terrorism and that threat. Continue reading...
items.content: Venezuelan opposition leader says she plans to return to her country as soon as possibleDeposed Maduro pleads not guilty after capture in shock US attack on VenezuelaA UK minister would not be drawn into saying whether his government believes the US capture of Venezuela’s president was influenced by the country’s rich oil reserves.Asked on Sky News why he thought Donald Trump had captured Nicolás Maduro and said America would “run” Venezuela, Home Office minister Mike Tapp said:This is for Donald Trump to answer, and I think he has said in his press conference, which I watched with interest around narco-terrorism and that threat. Continue reading...

items.title: Iraq War veteran on Trump's push for regime change in Venezuela
items.standfirst: Phil Klay, a U.S. Marine veteran of the Iraq War and a professor at Fairfield University, joins CBS News with his reaction to the raid that deposed former Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and President Trump's calls for regime change.
items.content: Phil Klay, a U.S. Marine veteran of the Iraq War and a professor at Fairfield University, joins CBS News with his reaction to the raid that deposed former Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and President Trump's calls for regime change.

items.title: Questions about the legality of U.S. operation to capture Nicolás Maduro
items.standfirst: Questions remain about the legality of the operation that captured former Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Former federal prosecutor Scott Fredericksen joins CBS News to discuss.
items.content: Questions remain about the legality of the operation that captured former Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Former federal prosecutor Scott Fredericksen joins CBS News to discuss.

items.title: Maduro pleads not guilty on narcotics charges as Trump claims control of Venezuela
items.standfirst: Toppled Venezuelan president Nicolas Maduro appeared in a Manhattan federal court on Monday to face narcotics charges following a dramatic US operation that captured him in Caracas. The stunning move by President Donald Trump sent shockwaves through world capitals and raised urgent questions about the legality of US actions in the region.
items.content: Toppled Venezuelan president Nicolas Maduro appeared in a Manhattan federal court on Monday to face narcotics charges following a dramatic US operation that captured him in Caracas. The stunning move by President Donald Trump sent shockwaves through world capitals and raised urgent questions about the legality of US actions in the region.

items.title: U.S. looking to tap Venezuelan oil reserves
items.standfirst: President Trump is pushing for U.S. oil companies to tap into Venezuela's oil reserves following the raid over the weekend that captured Nicolás Maduro. Ed Hirs, energy fellow at the University of Houston, joins CBS News to discuss.
items.content: President Trump is pushing for U.S. oil companies to tap into Venezuela's oil reserves following the raid over the weekend that captured Nicolás Maduro. Ed Hirs, energy fellow at the University of Houston, joins CBS News to discuss.

items.title: Who is Delcy Rodriguez, Venezuela's interim president?
items.standfirst: Delcy Rodriguez has been sworn in as Venezuela's acting president. CBS News' Lilia Luciano has more on who she is.
items.content: Delcy Rodriguez has been sworn in as Venezuela's acting president. CBS News' Lilia Luciano has more on who she is.

items.title: Details on Venezuela's oil reserves
items.standfirst: President Trump is pushing for U.S. oil companies to invest in Venezuela's oil industry after the capture of Nicolás Maduro on Saturday. Philip Luck, director of the CSIS Economics Program, joins CBS News to discuss.
items.content: President Trump is pushing for U.S. oil companies to invest in Venezuela's oil industry after the capture of Nicolás Maduro on Saturday. Philip Luck, director of the CSIS Economics Program, joins CBS News to discuss.

items.title: Breaking down the operation that captured Nicolás Maduro
items.standfirst: New details are emerging about "Operation Absolute Resolve," the mission that captured former Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Military analyst and Retired U.S. Army Major Mike Lyons joins CBS News to discuss.
items.content: New details are emerging about "Operation Absolute Resolve," the mission that captured former Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Military analyst and Retired U.S. Army Major Mike Lyons joins CBS News to discuss.

items.title: Trump's calls for action against other countries after Venezuela "quite destabilizing," expert says
items.standfirst: Following the raid in Venezuela that captured Nicolás Maduro, President Trump called for a U.S. takeover of Greenland and threatened U.S. action against Colombia and Cuba. Brett Bruen, president of The Global Situation Room Inc., joined CBS News with his thoughts.
items.content: Following the raid in Venezuela that captured Nicolás Maduro, President Trump called for a U.S. takeover of Greenland and threatened U.S. action against Colombia and Cuba. Brett Bruen, president of The Global Situation Room Inc., joined CBS News with his thoughts.

items.title: Lawmakers react to briefing on Maduro capture
items.standfirst: Lawmakers on Capitol Hill shared their thoughts after a briefing Monday night on the operation that captured former Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. House Speaker Mike Johnson praised the mission, while Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer expressed concerns that similar military action could be carried out by the U.S. elsewhere.
items.content: Lawmakers on Capitol Hill shared their thoughts after a briefing Monday night on the operation that captured former Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. House Speaker Mike Johnson praised the mission, while Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer expressed concerns that similar military action could be carried out by the U.S. elsewhere.

items.title: Inside Maduro's defiant first courtroom appearance
items.standfirst: Former Venezuelan President Nicoás Maduro was arraigned Monday, declaring through a translator he is a "decent man," innocent of all charges, and "I am still president of my country."
items.content: Former Venezuelan President Nicoás Maduro was arraigned Monday, declaring through a translator he is a "decent man," innocent of all charges, and "I am still president of my country."

items.title: Conditions on the Colombia-Venezuela border as Trump threatens action against Colombian president
items.standfirst: Following the capture of former Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, President Trump on Sunday said Colombia is "very sick too, run by a very sick man." CBS News' Lilia Luciano has more from the Colombia-Venezuela border.
items.content: Following the capture of former Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, President Trump on Sunday said Colombia is "very sick too, run by a very sick man." CBS News' Lilia Luciano has more from the Colombia-Venezuela border.

items.title: Maduro says 'I was captured' as he pleads not guilty to drug trafficking charges
items.standfirst: A defiant Nicolás Maduro declared himself "the president of my country” as he protested his capture and pleaded not guilty Monday to federal drug trafficking charges that the Trump administration used to justify removing him from power in Venezuela.
items.content: A defiant Nicolás Maduro declared himself "the president of my country” as he protested his capture and pleaded not guilty Monday to federal drug trafficking charges that the Trump administration used to justify removing him from power in Venezuela.

items.title: Watch: What it was like in the courtroom at Maduro's hearing
items.standfirst: The BBC's Madeline Halpert was inside the room as the former Venezuelan president addressed the judge.
items.content: The BBC's Madeline Halpert was inside the room as the former Venezuelan president addressed the judge.

items.title: 'I'm a prisoner of war' - In the room for Maduro's dramatic court hearing
items.standfirst: During the 40-minute arraignment, Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, pleaded not guilty to drugs and weapon charges.
items.content: During the 40-minute arraignment, Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, pleaded not guilty to drugs and weapon charges.

items.title: Maduro says he is 'prisoner of war' - as Trump reacts to 'extraordinary' court hearing
items.standfirst: Nicolas Maduro's arraignment was an "extraordinary moment in history", US President Donald Trump has said, as the deposed Venezuelan leader made his first court appearance since being captured.
items.content: Nicolas Maduro's arraignment was an "extraordinary moment in history", US President Donald Trump has said, as the deposed Venezuelan leader made his first court appearance since being captured.

items.title: Delcy Rodríguez sworn in as Venezuelan president, but who is she?

clusters.title: Worries that Venezuela crisis could shift US focus away from Ukraine amid key talks
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukraine’s top allies meet in Paris to push for Kyiv’s security guarantees

items.title: Worries that Venezuela crisis could shift US focus away from Ukraine amid key talks
items.standfirst: Ukraine’s allies are meeting on January 6 in Paris for key talks that could help determine the country’s security after a potential ceasefire with Russia. But there are concerns that the Trump administration is shifting its focus to Venezuela, away from Ukraine. FRANCE 24's Rochelle Ferguson Bouyahi details what's at stake ahead of the Paris talks.
items.content: Ukraine’s allies are meeting on January 6 in Paris for key talks that could help determine the country’s security after a potential ceasefire with Russia. But there are concerns that the Trump administration is shifting its focus to Venezuela, away from Ukraine. FRANCE 24's Rochelle Ferguson Bouyahi details what's at stake ahead of the Paris talks.

items.title: Progress for Ukraine talks in Paris uncertain with U.S. focus shifting to Venezuela

items.title: 'Coalition of the willing' to gather in Paris to revive Ukraine peace talks
items.standfirst: European and US leaders will meet in Paris on Tuesday in a renewed push to end the war in Ukraine, with discussions focused on security guarantees and a near-finalised peace plan even as overnight Russian strikes killed civilians and underscored the urgency of diplomacy.
items.content: European and US leaders will meet in Paris on Tuesday in a renewed push to end the war in Ukraine, with discussions focused on security guarantees and a near-finalised peace plan even as overnight Russian strikes killed civilians and underscored the urgency of diplomacy.

items.title: Next expects profits to top £1.1bn after bumper festive sales
items.standfirst: Retailer warns that growth this year will be slower amid continuing pressures on UK employmentBusiness live – latest updatesThe high street retailer Next expects its annual profits to top £1.1bn after it rang up much stronger sales than expected over Christmas – but it has warned that 2026 will be tougher amid “continuing pressures on UK employment”.The clothing and homewares retailer said it was improving annual profit forecasts by £15m, its fourth upgrade in eight months, after UK sales rose by 5.9% in the nine weeks to 27 December, far stronger than the 4.1% expected. Continue reading...
items.content: Retailer warns that growth this year will be slower amid continuing pressures on UK employmentBusiness live – latest updatesThe high street retailer Next expects its annual profits to top £1.1bn after it rang up much stronger sales than expected over Christmas – but it has warned that 2026 will be tougher amid “continuing pressures on UK employment”.The clothing and homewares retailer said it was improving annual profit forecasts by £15m, its fourth upgrade in eight months, after UK sales rose by 5.9% in the nine weeks to 27 December, far stronger than the 4.1% expected. Continue reading...

items.title: Swiss bar where dozens died in blaze hadn't been inspected in several years

items.title: Jensen Huang Says Nvidia’s New Vera Rubin Chips Are in ‘Full Production’
items.standfirst: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says that the company’s next-generation AI superchip platform, Vera Rubin, is on schedule to begin arriving to customers later this year. “Today, I can tell you that Vera Rubin is in full production,” Huang said during a press event on Monday at the annual CES technology…
items.content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says that the company’s next-generation AI superchip platform, Vera Rubin, is on schedule to begin arriving to customers later this year. “Today, I can tell you that Vera Rubin is in full production,” Huang said during a press event on Monday at the annual CES technology…

items.title: Nvidia’s Rubin Chips on Track, CEO Huang Says
items.standfirst: Nvidia Corp.’s highly anticipated Rubin data center processors are in production and customers will soon be able to try out the technology, according to Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang. Meanwhile, Advanced Micro Devices Inc. announced a new chip for corporate data center use and talked up the attributes of a future generation of products for that market. Bloomberg Intelligence’s Masahiro Wakasugi breaks down the situation.
items.content: Nvidia Corp.’s highly anticipated Rubin data center processors are in production and customers will soon be able to try out the technology, according to Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang. Meanwhile, Advanced Micro Devices Inc. announced a new chip for corporate data center use and talked up the attributes of a future generation of products for that market. Bloomberg Intelligence’s Masahiro Wakasugi breaks down the situation.

items.title: AMD's Su Unveils New Tech, Talks Up AI Demand
items.standfirst: Analyst on AMD's New Tech, AI Demand DEK: Advanced Micro Devices CEO Lisa Su touted the attributes of a future generation of products, saying the pace of AI innovation has been incredible. Constellation Research founder Ray Wang provides context. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Analyst on AMD's New Tech, AI Demand DEK: Advanced Micro Devices CEO Lisa Su touted the attributes of a future generation of products, saying the pace of AI innovation has been incredible. Constellation Research founder Ray Wang provides context. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.content: Advanced Micro Devices Inc., aiming to make a dent in Nvidia Corp.’s stranglehold on the AI hardware market, announced a new chip for corporate data center use and talked up the attributes of a future generation of products for that market.

items.title: Nvidia CEO says Rubin in Production, Keynote Falls Flat
items.standfirst: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says their highly anticipated new Vera Rubin systems are nearing release this year. Speaking at CES in Las Vegas, Huang said customers will soon be able to try out the technology, helping speed AI development. Nvidia share's didn't react much to the presentation. Bloomberg Technology anchor Ed Ludlow breaks down Huang's keynote on 'Bloomberg: The Asia Trade.' (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says their highly anticipated new Vera Rubin systems are nearing release this year. Speaking at CES in Las Vegas, Huang said customers will soon be able to try out the technology, helping speed AI development. Nvidia share's didn't react much to the presentation. Bloomberg Technology anchor Ed Ludlow breaks down Huang's keynote on 'Bloomberg: The Asia Trade.' (Source: Bloomberg)

The free offering is aimed at creating vehicles that can think their way out of unexpected situations, such as a traffic-light outage. (Source: Bloomberg)

clusters.neutral_headline: Central African Republic president wins third term by landslide

items.title: Central African President leads provisional results in controversial election
items.standfirst: Provisional results released by the electoral council in the Central African Republic suggest President Faustin-Archange Touadéra has been elected for a third term with 76% of the vote. The results have been disputed by the second-placed candidate Anicet-Georges Dologuélé, who says he won. It has been a controversial election, with the main opposition party boycotting it and the two defeated candidates have complained about not being able to travel to some regions to canvas.
items.content: Provisional results released by the electoral council in the Central African Republic suggest President Faustin-Archange Touadéra has been elected for a third term with 76% of the vote. The results have been disputed by the second-placed candidate Anicet-Georges Dologuélé, who says he won. It has been a controversial election, with the main opposition party boycotting it and the two defeated candidates have complained about not being able to travel to some regions to canvas.

items.title: Central African Republic president wins third term by landslide
items.standfirst: The main opposition coalition boycotted the vote after a referendum allowed the removal of term limits.
items.content: The main opposition coalition boycotted the vote after a referendum allowed the removal of term limits.

items.title: Central African Republic's Touadera wins third presidential term
items.standfirst: Central African Republic President Faustin-Archange Touadera has secured a third term after the December 28 election, consolidating his rule in a country long plagued by instability. The vote was marked by low turnout and opposition claims of fraud, while analysts warn that security gains remain fragile despite peace deals with rebel groups.
items.content: Central African Republic President Faustin-Archange Touadera has secured a third term after the December 28 election, consolidating his rule in a country long plagued by instability. The vote was marked by low turnout and opposition claims of fraud, while analysts warn that security gains remain fragile despite peace deals with rebel groups.

items.title: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz Drops Reelection Bid Amid Welfare-Fraud Scandal, Trump Says 'No One Is Above The Law'
items.standfirst: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz has decided not to seek a third term in the upcoming election amid the welfare-fraud scandal. Walz Steps Aside, Cites Duty to Minnesota Walz, 61, announced his decision on Monday at the state capitol in St. Paul. “I can’t give a political campaign my all,” Walz stated.…
items.content: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz has decided not to seek a third term in the upcoming election amid the welfare-fraud scandal. Walz Steps Aside, Cites Duty to Minnesota Walz, 61, announced his decision on Monday at the state capitol in St. Paul. “I can’t give a political campaign my all,” Walz stated.…

items.title: Tim Walz drops out of Minnesota governor’s race, Klobuchar considers jumping in
items.standfirst: The former vice presidential nominee announced his decision on Monday.
items.content: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz dropped out of the Minnesota governor’s race on Monday, and Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-Minn.) is considering jumping in to replace him. Walz’s decision to not seek a historic third term upends the race and shocked the Minnesota political world. The two-term governor, who served as the Democrats’ 2024 vice presidential nominee, was facing a potentially tough reelection fight as Republicans sought to tie him to a federal probe into a massive welfare fraud scandal in the state. Walz acknowledged that the scandal played a role in his choice. “Every minute I spend defending my own political interests would be a minute I can’t spend defending the people of Minnesota against the criminals who prey on our generosity and the cynics who prey on our differences,” he said in a Monday statement. Dozens of people have been charged with felonies for stealing hundreds of millions of dollars from Covid-era government programs intended to help feed children. Republicans were eager to tie Walz to the scheme, though he is not accused of any wrongdoing. It’s a remarkable turn of events for the governor, who was elevated to national status by Kamala Harris in her 2024 sprint of a campaign and who until recently had left the door open to a 2028 presidential run of his own. “Many Democrats don't want him to run, including me,” said one senior Minnesota Democratic lawmaker, granted anonymity to speak candidly. “He is certainly not corrupt, but he has not handled the fraud problem well and we worry about his electability.” Walz met with Klobuchar on Sunday to discuss the campaign, according to two people familiar with the meeting. A person close to Klobuchar, granted anonymity to describe the senator’s private thinking, said the Minnesota senator is receiving encouragement to run and she's seriously considering it but has not decided on her plans. That development might be a boon to Democrats in the competitive state, as she has run well ahead of others in her party — including Walz — in past statewide campaigns. Republicans face a crowded primary for governor, including MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell, Minnesota House Speaker Lisa Demuth, state Rep. Kristin Robbins and Minneapolis attorney Chris Madel. The Republican Governors’ Association crowed over Walz’s exit, adding in a statement on Monday: “After presiding over one of the biggest fraud scandals in history it’s no wonder that Tim Walz is being forced to drop his re-election bid. Walz’s failed leadership is emblematic of Minnesota Democrats’ agenda and whoever Democrats choose to replace Walz with at the top of the ticket will need to defend years of mismanagement and misplaced priorities. Meredith Lee Hill contributed reporting.

items.title: US's long history of involvement in Venezuelan oil
